review: 垃圾暴雪他妈的搞这些我当年多喜欢这游戏就你们这样真的是恶心我们
You live for these moments

Idk why this game is getting reviewbombed by people saying it's a cash grab.  It's literally free.

This is a good game.  It had the potential to be a lot more, but because of Blizzard's internal problems, it's not.  People had very high expectations for it, and it never worked out, which is the source of a lot of negativity in the community.  However, on its own merits, Overwatch is still a very good game and changed the FPS genre.  If you're new, don't be scared off by all of us veterans who expected the world of this game.

垃圾傻逼游戏

Увидеть Overwatch 2 в стиме - это как увидеть бывшую на пороге своей квартиры. Да у тебя мелькают приятные воспоминания о том как вы познакомились, как много время провели вместе и как вам было хорошо... 

Но спустя время она перестала следить за собой, ты всё меньше стал проводить с ней время, стал видеться только по праздникам и в итоге всё закончилось тем, что ты ушёл. 

Как ты можешь видеть она нашла тебя снова. 

И ты вроде и пытаешься дать второй шанс, но чувства уже не те. Да и не особо то ей нужны твои чувства - для неё теперь важен твой кошелёк. Да ты можешь с ней сходить в парк, но полноценно она себя покажет, только после покупки чего угодно в магазине. 

И вот ты стоишь и думаешь "А стоит ли игра свеч?", а потом просто говоришь "Давай останемся просто друзьями"...

猫

从前，我养了一只猫，我有十块钱，会用八块钱给它买吃的，经常给它洗澡，它也很粘我。

后来，我带它出去玩，路人觉得它很可爱，他们给它喂猫粮，火腿肠，我很不开心，因为它是我的。我想把它抱回家，可是它挣脱我，冲着给它好吃的人喵喵，我抱了几次他都不跟我走，还挠伤了我，于是我转身就走了.....

后来，偶然在路上遇到了它，它身上脏兮兮的。路人们只会给它好吃的，陪它玩玩，却不会带它回家，给它洗澡。它看到我后就跟着我回家，我把它关在了门外，它在门外喵喵地叫着，叫的我很难受，
可是我不会再要它了
。

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

I have 1k+ hours on Battle.net.



[h1]Overwatch 2 isn’t a sequel. It’s a lazy seasonal update.[/h1]
Don’t be fooled by smoke and mirrors: the main change from the original to OW2 is monetizing every nook and cranny with real money. The original Overwatch was light on monetization. 
In OW1: You bought the game, and you [i]could[/i] pay for optional loot boxes.
In OW2, you can/[i]must[/i] pay for: [list]
[*]Old skins previously obtainable for free (up to 20€ per skin)
[*]New skins
[*]Every new hero (used to be free)
[*]Emotes
[*]Gun charms
[*]Battle pass
[/list]
See, Blizzard knew they can’t just update Overwatch with these drastic changes to monetization, without rousing severe backlash. Their solution was to release a “sequel” in the guise of a “new game”; This sequel turned out to be merely an update to the already-existing Overwatch.
Imagine if Valve implemented an update to Team Fortress 2 that changed its title to ‘Team Fortress 3’, or if Square Enix announced  in the next Final Fantasy 14 update, that he game will hereby be known as Final Fantasy 15.
It’s an extremely scummy way of treating your IP and customers. Just erase the old version, the new one will be superior right?! Here, have a new hero and some maps, it’ll divert your attention from the soulless, greedy implementation of monetization to every aspect of the game

The game lacks the same magic and hook that got you into OW1, giving you the sensation that it was made with completely different people in charge. And it was. Jeff Kaplan, who directed OW1 and was responsible for its final implementation, suddenly quit mid-OW2 development - can’t imagine why - after happily announcing what they’re doing to make OW2 far improved to the original. 
The original draw was an emphasis on co-op PvE missions.
These missions were officially cancelled recently.
Let it sink in: the sole reason for the sequel’s existence was cancelled - after the sequel was already launched.
Granted, they seemingly introduced similar missions recently. These are still a far cry from the original intent.

I can’t be bothered to write at length about Californian identity politics festering their way into the game. The original Overwatch had a very diverse cast, because the game took place all over the globe. It was only natural to see people from different walks of life, with completely different mindsets and experiences. Among people with wildly varying ideals, none were treated as evil. The story had multiple anti-omnic rights heroes, who were still considered as talented and heroic people, despite not agreeing with some activist sentiment.
It felt organicl, and didn’t beat you over the head with <the right opinion> and <the message>.
So naturally, the sequel ruins it. Some time ago Blizzard publicly stated their process of creating characters, and it’s about exactly what you’d expect from current year.
In OW2, the heroes will be safe, tokenized, inoffensive and mellow robots compared to their original counterparts.

I only recommend trying OW2 if you never touched the first one. Everyone else: skip it.

游戏是好游戏，从16年玩到国服关服，还记得那个夏天打暑假工攒198买屁股，开学叫上社团好友一起开黑，连大学最好的兄弟也是因守望而结识，忘不了熬夜看上海龙40败在被子里哭的不成人样，世界杯离开说着你行我也行，diya在cc上演的爽文男主剧情，上海龙让三追四到次年拿下总冠军。
见证过守望的辉煌，也陪着它经历低谷，从未错过一个皮肤，买下了所有战令，本想着就算是凉了也会一直为了这些回忆坚持玩下去，但是国服没了，这么多年的账号没了，这一刻我明白了，我的青春也该结束了，作为玩家我从未抛弃守望，但是守望却选择离我而去。
就这样吧，上架steam，给个差评，有缘再见，也许再次回到那个夏天，当那只高血压猩猩问我的时候，我还是会说
——“我来，一如既往”
